comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: This photo is part of an ongoing digitization and research project at the Smithsonian Institution Archives. Please help us research this photo. View a related blog post here - blog.photography.si.edu/2009/03/30/who-are-you/

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: It's not the soil scientist who published in 1974 and 1976 as JM Deming, senior researcher at Monsanto--I just found his 1952 dissertation listed, that one is John M. Deming PhD.

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: Hi Effie! I've used this photo to illustrate a post on the Indicommons blog spreading the request: Help the Smithsonian: Women in Science.

comment.author: 69547139@N00
comment._content: This image is also on the "Images from the History of Medicine (IHM)" website, where the contributor is listed as "University of California".  Perhaps this information might help more details about this scientist come to light.

comment.author: 25053835@N03

It's helpful to make a reference, if the community would like to further their research. Sincerely, Susannah Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 69005233@N00
comment._content: 99% sure.... Jean Marjorie Deming, born 8 May 1895 in California. She was the daughter of Byron Briggs Deming (born in Humboldt Co, Cal.) and Harriett Newell Foster Deming (born in the Hawaiian Islands). She attended U.C. Berkeley (perhaps undergrad and grad? as she is listed in the 1918 yearbook as phi beta kappa and in the 1919 yearbook as a graduate student. The 1924 City directory for the Oakland area lists her as Asst instructor UC. In the 1930 US census, she is living at home with her parents in Auburn, Placer Co., California. She is 34 years old, single, and her occupation is "Doctor of Medicine". Her sister Dorothy, age 32, a librarian, also lives there. In 1932, she and her sister are in the Sacramento directory, living at 1619 I Street. Her sister is "asst County Library" and she is listed as "tech, Sacramento Hosp." 1936 she published this study in JAMA: archpedi.jamanetwork.com/article.aspx?articleid=1177227 I can find nothing about her after 1936. I did find that her sister (later Dorothy Deming Woodward) died in 1992. Some of her family history: Her father, Byron Briggs Deming b prob in Arcata, Humboldt Cal. on 19 Jan 1860. He died 16 Feb 1947 in Auburn, Cal. Her grandfather: Byron Deming, born Vt abt 1826 her grandmother Jane Pratt, born Vt about 1830 Here's a biography of her grandfather Byron Deming from the History of Humboldt County, California, 1915 www.onlinebiographies.info/ca/humb/deming-b.htm
